alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Charles City; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; New Kent; Prince George; Western Chesterfield; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 22 at 8:33AM EDT until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and south central Virginia, including the following areas, in central Virginia, Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights), Eastern Hanover, Eastern Henrico, Western Chesterfield and Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond). In east central Virginia, Charles City, Eastern King William, New Kent and Western King William. In south central Virginia, Brunswick, Dinwiddie and Prince George. * WHEN...From 2 PM EDT this afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain is expected to develop across northeast North Carolina and central Virginia late this afternoon into tonight, as developing tropical low pressure moves north off the southeast coast, eventually tracking inland across eastern North Carolina. Rain will continue into Saturday night. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected, with locally higher amounts possible through Saturday evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
